intro: Napimoga guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese napimoga, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous small seeds. Napimoga guianensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
